title: Drawing, "Personification of America", before 1720
medium: Pastel on paper mouunted on canvas
provenance:
Estate of James Hazen Hyde
Ex-collection: Laurence Currie, Coombe Warren, Kingston Hill, Surrey (Sold London, Christie's, December 17th, 1926 [Lot 134] for 168BP, the lot of four pastels [1960-1-7-a,b,c,d].
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description: Bust length portrait of a female Indian, her left breast exposed, and carrying a spear in her right hand. In her hair is a jeweled fillet, trimmed with feathers, and in her right ear she wears a lozenge-shaped jeweled pendant earring. On her back she carries a quiver of arrows. Her head is inclined slightly to the left and turned directly toward the viewer.
